name: Apex Waterloo Place Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My 12-year old son and I stayed at the Apex Waterloo Place for six nights in March and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel location is perfect - close to all the action without the night-time noise of some of the other downtown areas. Staff were very competent and friendly - we especially appreciated the quick and friend response to our call for help when we accidentally knocked out the electricity in our room when using a new voltage converter.
reviews.title: Another amazing experience with Apex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also enjoyed the hotel restaurant for a dinner and for all of our breakfasts - my son adored the lamb shank. All areas of the hotel were impeccably clean and stylish. The facilities were great: nice fitness room, hank business centre and swimming pool with funky lighting and ambient dance music.
reviews.title: Great location and comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I was in the UK last year I enjoyed stays at both the Dundee and London City Centre Apex hotels. After my stay at Waterloo Place, I will continue to say, "Well done Apex" and recommend your hotels to family and friends travelling to the UK.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel, brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just got back from 3 days in Edinburgh staying at the Apex on Waterloo Place. The hotel is in a great location, just at the bottom of Carlton Hill but within a stone's throw of busy Princes Street and a minute's walk (via the 'back door') to Waverley Station. Just round the corner from John Lewis and the Vue cinema complex, which we visited. Ate at a fantastic bistro called B'est on Drummond Street, just off North Bridge, and also at a Mexican which I think was called La Cantina (Rose Street area) and an Italian trattoria called La Rustica. We had delicious food and very friendly service at all these places.
reviews.title: Excellent service, location & staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife stayed the weekend and felt this was a really amazing hotel with friendly helpful staff and great food. Only drawback was the limited parking. Otherwise great hotel in good part of town close to shops park and station. Check out the pool, small but beautiful.
reviews.title: fantastic service, cleanliness,comfort and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night (Jan 1st), my partner and I were on the ground floor and my sister and her partner were on the 8th floor. We had the same view which wasn't very exciting, but didn't expect it to be great as the location of the hotel is tucked away slightly off Princes St. The room was nice, however our bath obviously hadn't been cleaned - as it was all hairy - and the conditioner hadn't been replaced in either of our rooms. We phoned housekeeping to ask that they clean the bath (because I'm a bath person) and to give them the opportunity to rectify the situation, which they did. The housekeeping manager came to look in the bath and she apologised, offered us a free drink in the bar and said she would get someone round to clean it right away. We didn't want a drink in the bar as we were just going to wait in my sister's room until it was clean. So that was a bit of a hiccup but they sorted it out for us so it's fine. My sister's bathroom had been cleaned properly, they'd just not given her any conditioner (we got some when ours was cleaned properly).
reviews.title: Disappointing, such a shame too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the spa facilities - pool, sauna and steam room. All were nice and quiet when we were there, very relaxing.
reviews.title: Clean, contemporary, modern with excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for a drink at the hotel bar before we went out for the evening. The bar looks fab, very trendy. However, our cocktails were not pleasant in any way. Cosmopolitans are usually a safe choice, however we had to let the men finish them on this occasion.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was very poor indeed. We were seated round a corner and then forgotten about - we waited for half an hour to order our coffee, tea and hot breakfast items. It was only when the seating host sat other people round the corner and saw our disgruntled faces still with our menus that he sent a waiter round to us. Not bringing coffee within ten minutes is poor, but making us sit for that long was ridiculous. When breakfast did finally come it was good, however we didn't get a warning about hot plates and my sister's partner burnt his hands - we also didn't get any teaspoons for the teas/ coffees. All the little things become noticeable when you are waiting for that long and get so annoyed!
reviews.title: Pleasantly impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So the terrible service at breakfast is unfortunately our lasting impression of the hotel. I wouldn't like to rule it out, because of the location and competitive price, however I think good service is worth paying for. So we wont be back.
reviews.title: Great location for transport links & sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lady who checked us in was fast and efficient, we were given a complimentary upgrade which was great and even though we arrived about 10.30am our room was ready straight away.
reviews.title: Only one blot on the copy-book

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very clean and spacious as was the bathroom, plenty of wardrobe space and nice little extra touches.
reviews.title: Stayed here for a family wedding - great location, friendly and helpful staff, wedding meal excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to eat in the bar on our first night and this was the only thing we have any complaint about. Our food took a long time to arrive and when it did one of the meals was not what had been ordered. After 25 minutes dessert still hadn't arrived so in the end we left without having any. The young Irish guy working in the bar was its' only redeeming feature, he was pleasant and courteous and did apologise.
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast every morning was good, plenty of choice and service speedy.
reviews.title: Extremely enjoyable hotel, with graet location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was well maintained during our stay and kept very clean.
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel, But Did Not Live Up to Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was located in the central of Edinburgh and it was easy to go anywhere.
reviews.title: highly recommended Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I had family room. Although it had a very small window and dark, the room was very big. If you prefer lighter family room, you should request in advance. There were a big bathtub and shower in the room.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had room service. The sandwich was quite good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel,Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Natalie who works as receptionist was really kind and helpful. She was alwasys willing to help and welcoming.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, modern and fresh.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I go back to Edinburgh, I surely go back to this hotel again.
reviews.title: stunning hotel in excellent location - great value

description: Located in the city centre to the East of Princes Street, this historic building combines traditional features with contemporary style. This four star deluxe hotel has 186 stylish en-suite rooms with widescreen LCD TV, large desk, free Wi-Fi and local calls, ground coffee and selected teas, luxury toiletries, iron and ironing board. Other facilities include Elliot’s Bar and Restaurant, Events space for up to 180, and a Spa. The spa's pool, sauna and gym are free to guests and a range of Elemis spa treatments can be booked in the single and couples treatment rooms.
